description:
Crashes very often, almost always when I listenin music through wine players. 
Audio quality is very good, effects awesome when it work)
Kubuntu 23.10, app flatpack 7.10, wine 9.7, player is aimp 5.30

This is just about useless for it's intended purpose, I only wanted a simple equaliser to adjust certain frequencies but this is way over complex for practical purposes.
The interface, layout and design seems OK but the controls seem to be making much greater adjustments than it says, my estimate is they are multiplying the adjustments by ten ! This creates huge issues with playback but that isn't the only issue, it crashes everytime I try to use it ! 
Extremely frustrating to use with KDE so I uninstalled it again !
I can hear brand new sound in my speakers! Love it! (It could have simple mode available, gosh it is loaded with options!)
Awesome app, very useful
Was able to get my headphones sounding so much more clear! (Sony WH-1000XM4)

Great except for the regular crashes. I often find that interacting with the UI, or possibly just switching between focused and unfocused states in the window, that it crashes about once or twice a day. Tried on Fedora Sway 40.
summary: Great except for the regular crashes

description: Thank you developer, the application works well and I really appreciate it.
summary: this app works fine on my ubuntu 24.04

description: Although I uninstalled the app. 100+ internal tools of app remains in my gnome menu, and cannot remove them.
summary: It messed up my gnome menu

description: filled my gnome panel with plugins, but none work
Unlocks the full potential of my Redragon Lamia 2 (Thanks Redragon for no drivers...), I can have a bit more punch in my sound now, very easy to use, especially for those who understand audio.
Fixed microphone noise issue!

I get error.
Launching Easyeffects failed.
org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.ServiceUnknown 

I am sure Fedora 36 Kinoite using Pipewire
this app is great. can customize a myriad of things, but mainly mic gain and noise cancelation
summary: my friends hate me less now for choosing to use linux lol

description: Works well on Kubuntu 22.04 after installing pipewire. Autostart works too. Thanks!

Have maybe everything you need to fine tune your sound setup. It is fantastic.

Would like a graphical preview of the EQ, but it works fine by listening.
used only for equalizer, it works

I was trying to replicate the effects I have on OBS in this app but not everything I wanted is here, namely the Gain. Autogain is here but it's not the same thing. Other than that, it does a decent job
This app really makes it easy and intuitive to work with audio effects. Thank you to the developers! This app is a must-have for every installation.
After following the tutorial from the manual my speakers are basically on par with the windows experience with some dolby presets

I have hearing loss so anything that improves the sound quality that helps me hear what I can beter is an ACE APP in my opinion and this is just such a hole in one right from the install and open!
 I listen on Klipsch Cinima 600, the soundbar with sub woofer and I am hearing the vocals of "The Look of Love" as offered by Amazon Music everthemore clearer!
 Thanks people!
summary: WOW! At;ast EQ plus much much more!

description:
Ueed PulseEffects before, and I ran into multiple problems. 
Sometimes audio was not working, sometimes pulse used to crash because of some issues, and now this fixed everything. Works flawlewssly (so far)
Amazing! Installed this after reading this article (https://cubiclenate.com/2021/07/17/pipewire-audio-server-on-opensuse-tumbleweed/) and all my audio problems were solved!

I had issues with the previous 'PulseEffects' version but this one works great on Fedora 38. Theres a lot of useful audio effects (such as EQ, noise reduction, compressor etc.) and all ive tried work really well. Highly recommend it.

just wowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww!
Thank you!
I added the Noise Reduction (with voice detection enabled) and it removed all background noise.
summary: Removes background noise with a quick filter

description: The amount of tweaks you can do is amazing. But if you are looking for a simple equalizer this might be a bridge too far.
downloaded presets from guthub - works fine . Thanks

I was looking to filter a laptop's built-in mic array not to sound terrible, like it did on Windows with some fancy properitary software. It works really well with RNNoise and all customizable effect chain. Also, preset autoloading is nice. All that provided the audio devices are set correctly.
Tune your sound system and get the most out of it. Many effects, settings and options. Almost everything you need to set up optimal sound.
summary: Great app to optimize your sound system

description: Some things have changed in here recently: I have to keep learning how to use it, however I run it all day long on my audio studio setup. Thanks.
Doesnt run on Kinoite version 39.20231114.0 under Flatpak
Works very nicely!

Coming from Equalizer APO, this is much better. 

One cool thing I would like is to have the option to force sample rates per profile (useful for convultion filter users)
powerful. it is not holding our hand, can be overwhelming at first
32 equalizer possible adj keys?! Wow, I had to bring it down to 12 for everyday use! LOL. Simply put: it works beautifully!
made me write my first review here, it's insanely good.
Best Equalizer Ever Works Flawlessly

I mean, it's like the title says. I love the software, it's one of the most versatile effects software's I've ever used. It's smart, simple and put together well. However, it's not perfect. If I do big things, like try to apply a 12 band eq preset or try to implement up a .txt file for my EQ, Easy Effects will crash altogether. I'm sure It's a simple enough fix, and I'll update this review if it changes, but for now it's a pain to deal with.

It works pretty well, I did have some instances where it wouldn't open on Manjaro, but after moving to EndeavorOS I was finally able to use this application. It's very good and lets me fine-tune my headphones to get my preferred sound profile. Small shout-out to autoeq.app (website) which provides preset files for Easy Effects that are tailored to your specific pair of headphones.

Runs great on Kubuntu! It has much more features that SteelSeires Sonar and is much lighter on the System, It even works great on my tablet, and provides much more bass for my wobly headset that I could ever get from Windows. It has issues running on the Steam Deck though.

I tried other tools mostly for compression, none was consistent and stable as this one. Easy to use, a good set of audio effects, the possibility to enable/disable the effects for specific audio sources is great. Simple, stable, does the job.

I appreciate the work of each one of you involved in this project!
just gives a "message recipient disconnected from message bus without replying" error, i'll just use PulseEffects
summary: won't work on Debian 12 KDE (manual install)

description: Everything that I was looking for
Funny how we have a much better [free] option for linux than for windows when it comes to audio.
Good audio enhancer

Been using the Flatpak package during its testing phase before it got officially released in Flathub beta, and it's been working very well. Kudos to the maintainer of the package for spending a lot of time making it work and huge thanks to the developers and contributors who have made EasyEffects what it is today!

this app can reverse left and right speaker easily
only one problem, it wont start after login

...and PulseAudio/PipeWire repositories are going crazy?!

RedHat wants to equip cars with PipeWire?
community wants something inbetween?
I just want to be left alone with something that actually works!
summary: ...somehow got caught up troubled in the transition process..

description: Do not run in background on ubuntu 20.04.3
Must have for distros using Pipewire
I am running ubuntu 20.04, are there any alternatives to this program i could try
Excellent app, made my SONY bt ear buds so much better on linux using eg the bass enhancer plugin. Just a few glitches when adding/removing/moving plugins around, but I can live with that. Good work!
I had a problem with noise capture with my microphone, and with just a plugin of noise reduction it is solved.

Recent updates are amazing.
Even windows have the software like this?️
Used to apply convolver preset for my AirPods. They're still AirPods, but at least this made it easy to improve them a bit.
Has a bunch of easy effects to apply to both input and output. You can make a microphone louder, and add noise cancellation for example.
summary: Super easy way to fix microphone sound quality

description:
Doesn't work after 6.2.7 update - no window shows up and, since the sound doesn't change, even though I have a preset set up, I assume that the app service doesn't work either.

Great selection of plugins, very useful for streaming and occasional recording. Very handy Monitor button. Has annoying little bugs, like a text field shows a value with a comma (i.e. 0,40) but only accept input value with a point (0.40).
summary: Was a good app until the update broke it

description:
Pro tip: You can use this to apply noise reduction to both outgoing *and incoming* audio, meaning you can compensate for heavy background noise from other people in calls!
Also for music listening, the audio effects and equalizer are great fun to play around with.
summary: Great collection of effects with amazing UI!

description:
I'm pretty much happy with default sound settings in Gnome but this applicaiton packs so much power in itself. Definetly would keep it around for those times I need to do something a bit crazier 🙂️

Thank you!
Works well than every alternatives
I like to set this up for video and voice calls. It is great.
Love it 10000%!
summary: Really awesome addition to linux!! alsmost on par with Viper4Android!

description: This is the last app you need to enhance linux audio.
...for both input AND output! For free!
Thank for your work!
Constantly freezes, very poor

I love the flexibility this app offers. Not just the EQ, but the compressor and bass enhancer? And there's stuff for inputs? It's awesome. Super easy to use, too.

Only problem is how frequently it crashes. It does this every time I swap to a present with an EQ, it seems. Kinda ridiculous.
summary: Super good functionality, crashes a lot

description: Has everything I could want and have been looking for with nice GTK and not much clutter, thank you.
Super einfach zu bedienen und das beste - es funktioniert einfach! Keine Einrichtung notwendig. Mgea. Danke für die App!
Genau danach habe ich gesucht. Sehr einfach einen Equalizer oder ähnliches zwischenbauen. Sehr viel anpassungsmöglichkeiten und neben dem schönen Design auch echt durchdacht und einfach zu bedienen.
Sometimes it even has too much parameters. Excellent work
Thank you very much.

Sehr einfach zu bedienender Mixer für Pipewire. Damit lassen sich auch laufende Streams in Tonhöhe und - tiefe mit wenigen Klicks anpassen und unter neuem Namen abspeichern. Und zugleich in den Systemstart einbinden. Genau so ein Programm habe ich gesucht!
Bueno para lo que lo use que queria sacar en el microfono el ruido de estatica lo logre sacar y anda bastante bien hasta ahora, espero que sigan mejorandolo se necesita vastante

Es una aplicación complicada que funciona muy bien en debian 12. 
Dado que hay tantas distribuciones de linux, los comentarios deben incluir la que se esté usando. 

Al que no le funcione, le sugiero que pruebe debian 12! 

Y ponte a estudiar porque el programa tiene infinidad de opciones
summary: Es una aplicación complicada que funciona muy bien en debian 12

description: equalizer no me fionan, si porngo youtube y BRI ESTOS APARA DARLE MEJOR SONIDO, OLVIDATE, NADA DE NADA

Creo que no esta pensado para funcionar en sistemas operativos basados en Ubuntu/Devian.
La version que si funciona es la que se instala por medio de comandos:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:mikhailnov/pulseeffects
sudo apt update
sudo apt install pulseeffects
summary: No funciona en KDE Neon este Flathub

description: Instalada de momento fedora 36, y funcionando correctamente, muy sencillos y potentes sus ajustes...
En ubuntu 22-10, actualización de abril 23, sí funciona.
es la opcion para quienes no les funcione pulse effects
tanto con presets de audio descargados, como con efectos personalizados da muy buenos resultados

Se rompen los menú son todos caracteres rectangulares.
Ante de eso funcionaba bien.
Working flawlessly
Хуже чем Pulseeffects. Тот хоть правильно реагировал на спад громкости.
Очень полезная программа с большим количеством настроек и предустановок
summary: Лучший инструмент для настройки звука на linux

description: как ни странно на моей нищей звуковухе на дачном компьютере эффеты и правда...работают и работают хорошо.стоит включить авторегулировку и звук вцелом становится лучше.а речевой процессор на удивление хорошо помогает если смотрю блогеров с ужасными микрофонами типа Эшли...это работает ,прям диво
Крутая штука. Не так давно перешёл на PipeWire на своей openSUSE, а тут как раз подходящее приложение для эффектов подъехало.
как звук? Отпишитесь плиз.
Наверни бассов рванина.Разведи свою гармонь!
summary: Из заветренной mp3-шки делает чистый и румяный flac

description: Постояно слетают настройки после пробуждения
новое поколениие Пульс-Эффекта. Другой аудиосервер. Будет в Убуну 22.04
Давно не испытывал такого комфорта на линукс)) Делайте продукты крутые ребята!
это будущее звука линукс
Отличный звук! Рекомендую всем попробовать.
Это просто невероятный инструмент. Больше бы таких качественных и нужных приложений на Linux.
Замечательно! Можно настроить звук, как душа пожелает.

У меня есть хорошие наушники и я нашёл настройку эквалайзера для них. Я установил это приложение и было легко научиться его использованию. Качество звука так сильно улучшилось... Я очень рад! Самое приложение отлично сработано, всё на понятном месте и приятно использовать его )
summary: необходимое если у тебя есть хорошие наушники
